item.title: Http
item.description: HTTP Http stands for (Hypertext transfer [[protocol]]) which is the language for the [[web]] How HTTP works Request response model You have to request information to the [[server]] in order to get a response TIME « Data It takes more to response but you want to make sure that the page is complete It uses [[TCP]] protocol for the transmission and stability Simple HTTP request/ response You can create a server with you preferred programming language You can send a request from different clients such as: curl NetCat 1 2 3 4 GET / HTTP 1.

item.title: protocol
item.description: Protocol A protocol is a way for machines for communicate with each other. You can think of them as a language what everyone agrees in order to understand what the other wants to say

item.title: Singleton
item.description: [[Zettelkasten/Design Pattern]] Singleton The singleton pattern is part of the [[SOLID]] standard and it means that only one instance of a class should be created and used across the app

item.title: Slowloris DDOS Attach
item.description: Slowloris DDOS Attach This attack is made basically by creating thousands of incomplete requests and keep the connections alive and overload the server.

item.title: Swift Data Types
item.description: Nil Data Types [!NOTE] Data types in swift Swift supports Six data types which are [[#Int]],[[#String]],[[#Float]],[[#Double]],[[#Bool]] and [[#Character]] Type Inference (AKA “Swift knows”) Is not necessary to explicitly tell the variable which type is going to hold if you assign a value when you create it.
